Name: ArchRavels: Magic Socks
Description:
The knitting scene goes crazy when a family of crafting gnomes comes to town with magic socks to trade. How will your skills expand when your feet are full of magic?

In ArchRavels: Magic Socks, you can trade items for enchanted footwear that doesn't just keep your toes warm: it gives you special rule-breaking powers.

This expansion also introduces two new character types, the Expert and the Maker, along with everything you need to play them. Take this opportunity to expand your table to welcome 5 or 6 players simultaneously! Don't worry, the 5-6 player rules keep the game about the same length, despite adding 50% more crafty goodness!

Finally, the Magic Socks expansion also includes some all new Special Projects to add a bit more variety to your knitting circle.

-description from publisher

Name: RisiKo! Più
Description:
Your objective is to fully occupy 3 Empires in addition to your own.

This game in the RisiKo! family of games is markedly different to the original RisiKo! as it has no territory cards, and players do not get armies based on the total number of individual territories, but instead for controlling regions, banners and castles.

The different cards in the game act as combat modifiers: Allow for players to carry on attacks that are otherwise not permitted, get reinforcement armies, force temporarily non-aggression pacts or look at another player's cards.

The game is remarkably similar to Castle Risk. There are, however, several differences -some of them rather substantial- between the two games. Just to describe a few of them (comprehensive list here):

     The game's objectives (wining conditions) are different: Total conquest in Castle Risk vs a prefixed amount of conquests (Fully occupy 3 Empires in addition to your own) in RisiKo! Più.
     "Spoils"/Reinforcements are to be reclaimed, in RisiKo! Più, in the beginning of each round, while in Castle Risk this is done at the end of the round instead.


—user summary

Name: FUSION: Clan War
Description:
FUSION: Clan War is a SciFi 3X Roll'n'write game centring around space combat in asteroid fields. Each round, players gather dice based on their expansions; roll the dice and take turns running commands. They can research technology, mine for resources, build ships and bases, move between asteroids, attack each other, and gain prestige. Destroy your opponent's bases or get to 20 Prestige to win the game!

-description from designer

Name: Rack Up
Description:
This matching-sets-for-points game is quick to learn and provides hours of play. Each card has a point value, with big game yielding more points than smaller game. The highest points go to the trophy rack buck. It’s a rare catch in this forest with only 2 available to hunt.

Each round players draw a card, create sets of cards to place down in front of them for scoring, and discard. A round ends when a player discards their last card. Any cards that are on the table in front of each player counts towards their score. Any cards left in their hand go against their score.

The first player to reach 1000 cumulative score, wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Dirty Dragsters
Description:
Dirty Dragsters is a competitive drag racing card game with a simple play mechanic for 2 or more players

Each player’s race kit comes in its own unique mint tin, including a car, acceleration cards, Instruction booklet and track pieces.

Start by building the track using track cards from two or more tins. Each heat, players choose any acceleration cards in their hand that add up to 10. This represents their acceleration for the current race. The remaining cards (which also add to 10) will form their acceleration for the next heat.

Shuffle all players’ chosen cards together for the current drag race and deal them face-up one at a time. The face-up deal determines who moves down the track, by how much, and in which order. The player to cross the finish line first wins that heat.

The first player to win five heats wins the championship.

Each car deck comes in its own tin for travel. Any number of players can join the race with a different car. Collect them all!

-description from publisher

Name: Cloud Foxes
Description:
A tactical board game of flying foxes and levitating islands.

Guide your pirate clan to victory by looting merchants, forging trade routes and wrestling control of the skies from your enemies.


BACKSTORY:

The cloud fox clans have always been divided, proving their dominance in tests of might, guile and flying prowess — but they never knew true conflict, until the humans came.

Seeking the magical wood of the Takka trees, which endows the Floating Isles and their giant fox denizens with the ability to levitate, the merchants built a vast fleet of sky ships. Swarming over the islands like a pestilence, they established ports, seized resources and displaced the cloud foxes.

You are the leader of a cloud fox clan and have allied with a band of human outlaws to take back your homeland. With the other clans competing for their share, will you be top fox in the new order?

GAMEPLAY:

The game takes place on a 6x6 grid. Roll three dice and assign one to select a row on the grid. Assign a second dice to select a column and the third dice determines what type of fox tile you get to place.

Each fox tile has an ability that activates immediately when placed as well a 'Control' value which determines how much control you have over the adjacent islands. Whoever has the most control over an island at the end of the game will score Vulpis Points (VP) for it.

You can also score VP for looting merchant ships and trading the resources with the matching ports at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pantheon
Description:
An asymmetrical strategy game. In Pantheon you will be tasked with the construction of a monument to honor your deities, but only one culture will endure in this clash of titans.

This 1v1 game, which can also be played against an automa, tastes like a war strategy game and has that card games aroma which will make you play again and again whether you win or lose.

You will have to adapt your moves to each deity's needs, but as soon as you know their hopes and fears, your games will become a battle of epic proportions.

Complete the different quests in the campaign mode and claim your victory in this Olympic competition.

The game takes about 1 minute to be learned and 15 minutes to play on average.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Rehbein: Klug für uns
Description:
Dennis Rehbein is a local politician of the German town Hagen.

Each of the 23 square cards shows 4 pictures in a grid 2 by 2. Each picture shows one of 4 politicians of the CDU (German party). Before the game begins, each player chooses one of these politicians. 3 mission cards face up show each an arrangement of several pictures. On your turn, draw a card and add it to the display. If you meet the condition(s) with your politician, you collect 1, 2 or 4 victory points for the according mission card(s). The player who reaches 12 victory points, wins.

—user summary

Name: Programme Guide 7TV2: The Argonauts
Description:
The Argonauts – the mechanical monsters ruled with an iron fist and cold logic by mad scientist Dr Ulysses Argo. Argo seeks revenge on a world he claims betrayed him. Through the armoured might and superior technology of his mechanical creations, he plots to bring down governments, institutions and individuals and replace them with cold logic and unfeeling machines.

This 40 page printed booklet for the 7TV second edition rules contains:

Background information on the filming and fictional history of the Argonauts.
Information on cast members with tactical tips on how to use them in play.
35 Profiles with full rules for Argonaut stars, co-stars, extras, vehicles and units.
6 new episodes – playable by both Argonauts and any other 2nd edition casts.

Name: Durch unsere bayerische Heimat
Description:
On a map of Bavaria you travel on a web of roads using the spaces by rolling the die. Some spaces trigger an event causing earning or losing money. As there is no mandatory route, you may try to avoid negative spaces. You must visit the 7 capitals of the Bavarian regions, then return to your starting town. Among the first 3 players meeting this condition, the richest one wins.

—user summary

Name: Mixture Mischief: Black Cat promo card
Description: Black Cat promo card, the card increases the difficulty level of the Mixture Mischief game by adding additional Cat Card

Name: Nine-minute Kingdom: Expansions
Description:
Wind of History is blowing. Wealthy and prosperous Kingdom is expanding. New Subjects appear in the court, gold and silver attracts Dragons, and above all, now you have to follow Queen's Will. Try our expansions to improve your game experience. This box contains four Nine-minute Kingdom expansions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nine-minute Kingdom: Variants
Description: Change the rules! Add more variations to your Nine-minute Kingdom play. In this variant pack you can include new game modes, play duel version and cooperate with other players. If you want real time experience, try the Instant mode. You can even be a traitor, who will try to ruin the score. This box contains four variants of the Nine-minute Kingdom game.

Name: Project: KA-POW!
Description:
A thee in one card game, featuring Public Domain Superheroes, redesigned.

The deck can be used to play three different games:


     "Border Patrol" a solo game where you fight alongside Public Domain Heroes with the purpose to make five victories, in random difficulty battles.



     "Warfront" a two player game where the players fight each other with the purpose to collect as many "medals of honor" as possible.



     "Fighting Army" a solo game  where you fight through waves of enemies and allies-turned-enemies with the purpose to eliminate them all.


—description from the designer

Name: Zombicide (2nd Edition): Complete Upgrade Kit
Description:
The Kit brings you all of the special Zombies, Companions, and Survivors from the classic Zombicide game, now fully upgraded to Zombicide: 2nd Edition!

This upgrade kit comes with all the spawn cards you need to make your 1st edition special zombies, abominations, and Characters to usable in the 2nd edition of the game. Bonus, the VIP cards can double to pull out Reboot zombies if you have the Kickstarter box. Zombicide (2nd Edition): Zombies & Companions Upgrade Kit did not include the Survivor ID cards.

COMPONENTS
-70 Survivor ID Cards
-3 Special Abomination Cards
-6 Abomination Cards
-11 Toxic Zombie Cards -11 Berserker Zombie Cards
-36 Skinner Zombie Cards 12 Seeker Zombie Cards
-12 Dogz Cards
-12 Crowz Cards
-12 V.I.P. Zombie Cards
-6 Lost Zombivor Cards
-14 Companion Cards

Name: Trick Builder
Description:
In this trick taking deck builder game you will be building your own personal deck to be then used to take tricks. Be the first person to win enough tricks to win.

—description from the designer

Name: 大戦争のあとしまつ (Cleaning Up the Mess After a Great War)
Description:
In å¤§æˆ¦äº‰ã®ã‚ã¨ã—ã¾ã¤ (Daisensou no Atoshimatsu), roughly "Cleaning Up the Mess After a Great War", players take on the role of political superpowers aiding in a fictional war.

It is a trick avoidance game, which is to say a trick-taking game where the aim is generally to not win tricks, as most will lose points for the winner.  However, the winner of a trick will place one of their flags on a market futures board where they will guess the icons on cards the players discarded to a face down pool at the start of the hand.  If accurate, these pay offs can make up for the points lost during the trick play.

After one hand, the player with the most points wins.

The front of each card has a top and a bottom showing different suits and ranks.

Name: The Worriers
Description:
The Worriers is a psychological cooperative game in which 1 to 4 players become characters with unique skills.
In this game you have to try on the role of an anxious person, look at the world through their eyes and realize how many challenges stand in their way every day!
At the beginning of the game each player has 3 life tokens (the total amount of points is 12), 3 challenge cards and 3 bonus cards. Superclass cards are postponed until the final stage.
Class cards remain implicated in the challenge deck and drop out to players randomly during the game itself. Also in the game there are goal cards that are in the challenge deck (they come to players during the game). After receiving the goal, you put it in front of you next to the class card.
Each turn, one challenge card should be played with a dice roll. If the number that falls out is greater than the number indicated on the challenge card, then the card is played and can be put away in a discard or folded into a set of goal cards.
On each card, there are symbols in the upper left (bonus cards) or right (challenge cards) corner. On the bonus card - a positive or negative bonus. On the challenge card - the number of bonus cards that must be used to draw the card. If there are still not enough points, then life points are taken away from you according to the number of uncovered points (the total number of bonuses and challenges on the table is 8, 5 fell on the cube, 3 life points would be taken away from you).
Players need to collect the complete set indicated on the goal card. After reaching the specified condition, the player receives a random superclass card, loses health points and continues the game. The game ends when all players have fulfilled the conditions indicated on the goal cards (or by agreement).

Name: Glorious Wrestling Alliance: Ultrabrawl
Description:
The lights come up. The bell rings. Minutes ago you were in a sweat-drenched locker room; now you’re in the centre the ring, fending off attacks from a glistening muscleman with a fish for a head. This is the Glorious Wrestling Alliance - and you’re the newest addition to the roster!

Glorious Wrestling Alliance: Ultrabrawl is a fast-and-frantic card game for 2-4 players that captures all the honour, passion and pageantry of the squared circle. Based on the comics of the same name, Ultrabrawl sees players assume the roles of one of six GWA combatants as they slug it out in their mission to be crowned champion!

Players play move cards in order to chain together combos, deal damage to their opponents and woo the crowd - all in service of nabbing that all-elusive pinfall. Cards will be drawn, dice will be rolled, egos will be bruised and crushing finishing manoeuvres will be deployed, as the GWA’s faintly ridiculous combatants chop, kick and suplex their way to victory!

—description from the designer

Name: Corsaire
Description:
In Corsaire, the players take on the role of merchants and privateers - trading in the first half of the game and looting in the second.

The cards in the game have a number, one of three suits/colors, and a way to convert resources (e.g. change one red into two blue).  In the first half of the game, players are building a pyramid on their side, starting with the base. Whenever a player adds a card to the 2nd level or higher, they can activate that card's trading ability, and then trace that back to the base of the pyramid, activating any cards along the way that they desire.  Ultimately the path will trace back to some ship boards in the middle which hold both the cards the players will refill their hands with, as well as a cost to buy the ship board.

Once the players' are finished building their pyramid, the looting begins.  Players will form 3-card poker type hands on each of the ship boards.  They can choose from the cards remaining in their hands or the cards in their pyramid; however, to choose cards from the pyramid, they must "unbuild" the pyramid from the top and can only access uncovered cards.  Once the players have both added 3 cards to each board, the boards are evaluated and points are awarded.

The player with the most points from the boards acquired during trading and the boards acquired during looting wins.

Name: Qwixx: 10 Jahre Limited-Edition
Description: Qwixx has existed for ten years, and to celebrate Qwixx: 10 Jahre Limited-Edition is a special edition of the game that includes the Qwixx base game, as well as the Bonus and Gemixxt expansions and the components needed for the Qwixx Longo standalone game. All of the boards are erasable, and the game includes dry-erase markers.

Name: Rollasaurus
Description:
Take a trip back in time as you roll the dice and find the dinosaur that matches the colour and pattern that was rolled. The first player to fill up their scene with dinosaurs and do their best dino roar is the winner!

Not only is this game educational, it will test Colour, number and pattern recognition as well as coordination and reflexes.

The player boards feature simple facts about the dinosaurs in the game too, it also includes a golden dinosaur trophy to award to the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: Unnecessary Inventions
Description:
This is the reason your mom always told you to pay attention in school! Unnecessary Inventions, a game inspired by the hit social media sensation, challenges players to come up with creative, innovative ( and ridiculous) solutions to common , everyday problems ( that most people don't really care about). Be the player with the most invention cards at the end of game play to win the top spot. Happy Inventing!!

GET CREATIVE: Unnecessary Inventions is a card game that turns players into their own inventors and brings out everyone's creativity, while getting friends & family together for a fun game night or gathering.

HOW TO PLAY: Draw an invention card and read it aloud to all players. Then flip over the 2-minute timer and start inventing! Solve the Invention-Time problem, coming up with your own invention’s name, description, and a drawing of the invention.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?! Each game comes with everything needed for over 70 rounds of fun: 74 invention time cards, 6 dry-erase pens, 6 dry-erase boards, and a 2 minute sand timer.

Name: Tiny Robot Love Doctors
Description:
Get ready to work with your team of byte-sized DocBots to hack into your patient's heart-drive and zap away all the bad feels until only love remains! A challenging cooperative puzzle game for 1-4 players with cute characters and quirky, positive vibes.

Use shape cards (and your spatial reasoning skills and Docbot's unique abilities) to remove matching bad feels tiles. Love tiles are wild and monsters might cause problems if you play at one of the optional higher difficulties.

Tiny Robot Love Doctors is perfect for family game nights, parties, and even therapeutic or educational gaming. It's also optimized for solo play!

—description from the publisher

Name: ArchRavels: Rivals
Description: Even the world of fiber arts can get a little competitive sometimes. This mini-expansion introduces new rules and components for crafters with slightly sharper knitting needles.

Name: The Unseen: You Have Been Chosen
Description:
Assemble your friends and set off on a unique co-operative, role play, story driven adventure into The Unseen world: a spiritual battleground where you and your team of Word Wielders take on hordes of demonic afflictions. Strategize and fight back the armies of darkness to expose the Monarchs of Doubt, Guilt, Fear, Sickness, Suffering, and Hatred. These Strongholds of ever-present lies must fall!

This game includes 9 different Word Wielder heroes to choose from, each with their own unique set of Gifts (abilities) from 4 different Classes: Champions (Melee/Tank), Seekers (Range/Bow & Arrows), Edifiers (Prayer Type Weapons/Words of Holy Fire and Healing Light), or Discerners (Dynamic & Well-rounded/weapon specializations are player’s choice).

Play through The Story (main campaign) that is broken out into 7 Chapters meant to be experienced over multiple sessions. Each Chapter can take between 60-90 minutes to complete. There are Checkpoints provided to help you pick up where you left off even if you put the game away.

Gameplay alternates between Two Phases:
One - The Chosen Phase where player’s spend their chosen Word Wielder’s Guidance Prayer and Action tokens to prepare for and battle The Darkness by rolling dice and comparing results against the enemy stats, and advance the Chapter objectives and
Two - The Darkness Phase where the Darkness on the board then takes their Actions trying to Burden and Overwhelm the Word Wielders in order to stop them.

So equip yourselves for battle by praying for Discernment, allowing you to draw from over 90 cards packed with anointed Weapons of Light, Armor, and Single-Use items. Each new card collected has its own abilities offering your Word Wielders limitless combinations and tactical possibilities. Slay the Darkness and collect their cards to build up a Light Pool - once enough enemies have been slain, return them to the Darkness Deck and draw a Heaven’s Armies Card with one of three different Angels that can be played to help your Wielders gain the advantage in battle. Work together to overcome the Darkness!

Get swept away in over two hours of intense, fully-narrated, audio dramas that bring each chapter of the game to life; drawing you into an epic journey you won’t soon forget. These can be found and listened to for free on the game’s official website.

Once you’ve played through the epic campaign you can continue your adventures in 7 nonlinear alternate game modes, each introducing new stories, objectives, and ways to play.

(PVP) Or, if you’re looking for something more classically competitive but with a twist, step on to The Sea of Glass (flip side of the board), for a bright and colorful map made for fast paced, lighthearted, head-to-head combat where you can compete against one another in 4 more game modes where it’s a race towards the objectives while Refining each other along the way through inevitable encounters.

With so many different variables and ways to play, no two games are ever the same…

Go, and know that He is with you!

—description from the publisher

Name: ArchRavels: Awards Season
Description: Your friends and family love your fiber arts projects, but now it's time to show your work to the wider world. That's right, it's AWARDS SEASON!  This mini-expansion for ArchRavels provides the components and rules for solo play. Find out if you have what it takes!

Name: ロンデルラミィ (Rondel Rummy)
Description:
You are a Venetian jeweler. Make a bracelet with Venetian glass beads known as “rondelles.”

In Rondel Rummy, players compete to make bracelets. Players begin each round by adding beads to either side of their empty metal hoop. Once everyone has a full bracelet, players take turns exchanging with the beads on a metal tray.

In order for a bracelet to be complete, the beads must create a rainbow with every available color or a symmetrical design. When the hoops are closed, players can strategically rotate their beads. After a player completes their bracelet, the other players may each make one more exchange. Points are scored based on the number of colors on a complete bracelet. Rounds are repeated until a player or players score 5 points, winning the game.

The components are tactile and interactive. Bright beads and metal hoops make up the bracelets. Beads are held in a soft bag and displayed on a metal tray. Players keep track of their points using colorful finger rings. The components and engaging rules make for a unique experience.

Name: The Seal Of Pragon
Description:
The Seal Of Pragon is a traditional-style solitaire card game that only requires a single deck of standard playing cards (with two Jokers). The layout for this game looks roughly like a five-pointed star. The goal of this game is to remove all cards from the table by creating poker hands.

A clever array of action bonuses are afforded the player for every poker hand achieved. Examples include everything from removing cards to accessing the discard pile (helping to prolong the game).

The title for this game comes from its loose backstory. As stated by the designer "It roughly involves the player being part of an ancient order trying to break a seal which will unleash an ancient evil if it is not broken before dawn."

The Seal Of Pragon was a 2013 Print & Play Contest entry.

Name: King of Tokyo: Gift Promo Cards
Description:
Three cards given by the Devir staff to every participant of the King of Tokyo tournament during the Mega XP 2022 event held in Mexico. Shuffle them with the base game cards to add variety to the game.


     Secret Fan: upon obtaining this card, secretly choose another player's name. If that player wins the game, so do you!
     Personal Tutor: anytime another player gains [heart], you may make that player earn one additional [heart]. If you do, you earn one [star] or one [heart].
     Generous Spirit: Once during each one of your turns, you and another player you choose each gain one [star]. 


These cards were also given out to participants of the "King of Tokyo Tournament - Hug Season" at the 2022 UK Games Expo

Name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Liber Hereticus Traitor Legiones Astartes Army Book
Description:
The Space Marine Legions of the 31st Millenium field a diverse and formidable range of genetically-enhanced warriors and advanced war machines, superior to any other military force in the galaxy. As an Age of Darkness falls across the stars and the fires of rebellion rage out of control, the armies that were used to forge the Imperium turn upon each other in an apocalyptic civil war – the Horus Heresy.

Of the eighteen Space Marine Legions, fully half have betrayed their oaths. Defiant servants of the Warmaster, these Space Marines gather strength to overthrow the Emperor and claim the Throneworld of Terra. In the turmoil of the Horus Heresy, the Traitor armies unleash powers and ambitions beyond mortal reckoning, waging bitter war against their former brothers – those that still cling to their oaths and stand by the Emperor. By the determination and fury of these rebellious warriors will the fate of the Imperium, and that of humanity itself, be decided.

This book is an essential guide for anyone who wants to command a Traitor Legiones Astartes force in Warhammer: The Horus Heresy. It contains all of the rules you need to field every unit and formation available to Traitor forces, from core units and weapons shared by every Space Marine Legion to specialist rules for each of the Traitor Legions – including Rites f War, unique wargear, signature units, and their legendary Primarchs.

Inside this 352-page hardback book, you'll find:


     Rules and unit profiles covering every unit, weapon, and piece of wargear available to the Traitor Legiones Astartes in Warhammer: The Horus Heresy
     Legion-specific special rules, Warlord Traits, Reactions, Rites of War, wargear, unit profiles, and unique characters for each of the Traitor Legions: the Emperor's Children, Iron Warriors, Night Lords, World Eaters, Death Guard, Thousand Sons, Sons of Horus, Word Bearers, and Alpha Legion
     Profiles for each of the Traitor Primarchs: Fulgrim, Perturabo, Konrad Curze, Angron, Mortarion, Magnus the Red, Horus the Warmaster, Lorgar Aurelian, and Alpharius
     A visual showcase for each Traitor Legion, containing heraldry markings, colour schemes for infantry and vehicles, and a small gallery of stunning miniatures photography


—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Horus Heresy – Age of Darkness

Name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Liber Astares Loyalist Legiones Astartes Book
Description:
The Space Marine Legions of the 31st Millenium field a diverse and formidable range of genetically-enhanced warriors and advanced war machines, superior to any other military force in the galaxy. As an Age of Darkness falls across the stars and the fires of rebellion rage out of control, the armies that were used to forge the Imperium turn upon each other in an apocalyptic civil war – the Horus Heresy.

Of the eighteen Space Marine Legions, only half remain loyal to their oaths. Heroes without equal, these Space Marines rally to defend the Emperor and all he has strived to build. In the turmoil of the Horus Heresy, the Loyalist armies stand firm against a tide of corruption and betrayal, waging bitter war against their former brothers – those that have forsworn their oaths and turned upon the Imperium. By the courage and might of these steadfast warriors will the fate of the Imperium, and that of humanity itself, be decided.

This book is an essential guide for anyone who wants to command a Loyalist Legiones Astartes force in Warhammer: The Horus Heresy. It contains all of the rules you need to field every unit and formation available to Loyalist forces, from core units and weapons shared by every Space Marine Legion to specialist rules for each of the Loyalist Legions – including Rites f War, unique wargear, signature units, and their legendary Primarchs.

Inside this 344-page hardback book, you'll find:


     Rules and unit profiles covering every unit, weapon, and piece of wargear available to the Loyalist Legiones Astartes in Warhammer: The Horus Heresy
     Legion-specific special rules, Warlord Traits, Reactions, Rites of War, wargear, unit profiles, and unique characters for each of the Loyalist Legions: the Dark Angels, White Scars, Space Wolves, Imperial Fists, Blood Angels, Iron Hands, Ultramarines, Salamanders, and Raven Guard
     Profiles for each of the Loyalist Primarchs: Lion El’Johnson, Jaghatai Khan, Leman Russ, Rogal Dorn, Sanguinius, Ferrus Manus, Roboute Guilliman, Vulkan, and Corvus Corax
     A visual showcase for each Loyalist Legion, containing heraldry markings, colour schemes for infantry and vehicles, and a small gallery of stunning miniatures photography


—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Horus Heresy – Age of Darkness

Name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Age of Darkness Rulebook
Description:
An Age of Darkness has descended upon the galaxy. Horus Lupercal, Warmaster of the Emperor's armies, has turned against his gene-father and sent the Imperium spiralling into bloody civil war. Of the eighteen great Space Marine Legions, finest of all humanity's soldiers, fully half have sided with the traitorous Warmaster, while the remainder stand staunchly loyal to the Emperor. It is a war of brother against brother, Space Marine against Space Marine, which has seen the might of the Imperium's vast armies turned upon itself in a cataclysm of fire and blood.

In Warhammer: The Horus Heresy you will pit mighty armies of superhuman warriors against each other in apocalyptic tabletop battles. Choose your favoured Legion, from the knightly Dark Angels to the duplicitous Alpha Legion, build your own army from a range of spectacular Citadel and Forge World miniatures, and clash with fellow players in wargames of staggering tactical depth. The tale of the Horus Heresy is the bedrock of Warhammer 40,000's rich history, and this boxed game is the perfect first step to joining the epic conflicts that reshaped the galaxy.

This 336-page hardback Rulebook contains:


     Extensive background on the Emperor, the Great Crusade, the Imperium, the 18 Legiones Astartes, and the galaxy-spanning conflict that became known as the Horus Heresy
     Core rules for playing Warhammer: The Horus Heresy, including general principles, shooting and fighting, unit types, special rules, and more
     Rules for the five modes of play: Narrative Play, Campaign Play, Open Play, Team Play, and Matched Play
     A miniatures showcase containing eight armies created by members of the Warhammer: The Horus Heresy Studio and beyond


—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Horus Heresy – Age of Darkness

Name: Little Astronauts
Description:
Discover the planets and be the first to complete your space mission!

Simply draw a card to discover a planet, and place it in the correct location in your solar system. The first astronaut to complete their solar system wins!

Children learn skills such as turn-taking, counting and strategy, and get to laugh at each other's silly alien impressions! They can also learn simple facts about each planet as they play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Draftosaurus: Marina e Show Aéreo
Description:
2-in-1 Expansions:

Draftosaurus: Aerial Show expands the boundaries of your park and adds a new species to draft: pterodactyls!

This expansion for Draftosaurus adds a double-sided board that each player can combine with their existing park to add a new mountain zone. Pterodactyls are the only dino-meeples that can be placed on this part of the board, and each of their nests offers you a specific bonus in return, ranging from extra points to immunity to the placement die!

Draftosaurus: Marina expands the boundaries of your park and adds a new species to draft: plesiosauruses!

This expansion for Draftosaurus adds a new double-sided board that each player can combine with their existing park to add a new river zone. Plesiosauruses are the only dino-meeples that can be placed in this part of the river, granting points at the end of the game. To move your plesiosaurus further down the river and earn more points, you must place specific other species in your park to unlock the dams one by one!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Hora de expandir seu parque
Draftosaurus – Expansão 2 em 1 é a combinação de duas expansões lançadas originalmente em 2020: Marina e Show Aéreo. A expansão convida os jogadores a retornarem para a divertida tarefa de construir um zoológico de dinossauros. E dessa vez temos duas novas espécies a disposição: os plesiossauros, que vivem nos rios do parque, e os pterodáctilos, que adoram morar nas altitudes montanhosas.

Já que temos novos animais, também surgem novos espaços para eles habitarem: o aviário, perfeito para os seus pterodáctilos, e a marina, o habitat ideal do plesiossauro. Essas áreas permitem ao jogador acessar maneiras de pontuar diferentes e únicas. Assim como no jogo base, ambas as áreas são frente e verso, entregando um nível de desafio diferente em cada um dos lados do tabuleiro.

Draftosaurus – Expansão 2 em 1 adota a filosofia de que em time que está ganhando não se mexe: você não vai encontrar nessa caixa mudanças que alterem profundamente sua experiência de jogo, mas sim um tempero extra capaz de abrilhantar ainda mais as partidas de um título que é amado por fãs no mundo todo.

Edição brasileira e reimpressão
Em outros mercados as expansões Marina e Show Aéreo foram vendidas separadamente. Para a edição brasileira a MeepleBR resolveu colocar o conteúdo das duas expansões em uma caixa só, o que facilita a vida de quem gosta de ter seus jogos completos.

E os fãs de dinossauros podem comemorar: além da Expansão 2 em 1, também veremos uma nova tiragem do jogo base Draftosaurus, o que é perfeito para quem quer garantir esse pequeno grande jogo na coleção.

—description from the publisher

Name: Qwixx: Double
Description:
Two new additional variants for Qwixx, bringing new number fields for more tactics and more points. The new fields count twice or can even be crossed twice. A whopping 136 points are possible per row.

The rules of the game remain exactly the same as in the original game. In addition, the new block variants can be freely combined and thus create a completely new gaming experience!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Hunt the Ravager: Temple of Secrets
Description: These are the Kickstarter stretch goals. It adds 2 unique locations: the Temple of Secrets and the City of Lights. New graphics, but no substantial change to gameplay.

Name: Turn a Phrase
Description:
There are thousands of possibilities in this game of connections! Simply place one hexagonal tile next to another and shout a word or phrase that connects the two illustrations.

For example; a tile with a bed and a tile with a person walking could be joined to make 'sleep walking'

You can even match with multiple tiles for a big bonus! Each tile can be interpreted in multiple ways, providing lots of play value. Gain a bonus turn by connecting tiles that have matching coloured backgrounds.

Can you be the first to get rid of all your tiles in this easy-to-pick-up picture game and claim victory!

—description from the publisher

Name: Submarine Deck
Description:
This is a card game for solo or multi-player use. The concept is using cards to enact a WW2 submarine or Wolf Pack attack on an Allied Merchant convoy.

Cards determine the size and type of ships, the hit or miss or torpedoes, depth charges, and gunfire. Cards represent damage accumulated, angle of attack, and the presence or lack of escorting warships and aircraft.

The objective of solo play is survival. For Multi-Player games, the objective is survival with the highest tonnage sunk. 
The player(s) are submarine captains.

—description from the designer

Name: ACW Battles: Stones River
Description:
A free print and play quick-playing entry level American Civil War wargame for 2 players, playable in 2 hours, where the intention is to have a core set of rules with which to play a number of different battles/scenarios.

The units are generic, so only need to be printed once. Each map and scenario card is a different battle. The first of which is Stones River.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Pyramids!: Curse of the Pharaoh
Description:
Osiris was Pharaoh, the first God King of Egypt and future farther of Horus, he was a great Pharaoh, but was murdered by Seth his brother the God of Chaos, who hid his body within the great Cursed Pyramid, guarded by fourteen Shabtis, Guardians of the Undead. Isis, Osiris’s faithful wife, pleads with you the wisest Warrior in all of Egypt to help her rescue the Pharaoh Osiris from the Pyramid so he can travel to the afterlife, but to rescue the Pharaoh’s spirit, you must defeat the evil Pyramid guards. The future of the whole of “Egypt”, is in your hands.

Light, Solitaire-style game for 1-2 Players.
Ages 12+ takes about 20-30 minutes and is an Egyptian Theme, filler game.

Solo play is fun as you battle to rescue the Pharaoh, the Solo game is quite a challenge so prepare to lose a few games.

Overall - Light filler, good for family game night and waiting for friends to arrive or to fill in some time with a bit of fun or for some quick Solo challenging play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cães POP
Description:
In Cães POP - Battle for Likes players are gathering likes playing pop dogs card's as internet influencers to gain followers. 
  
In the start of the game, players get 3 cards. In each turn, the player must discard a card to do an action, and take cards until reach 3 cards on hand.

Actions:


     Receive a Like: If playing dogs cards that is on focus.  
     Change focus: If playing dogs card's that doesn't is on focus  
     Do some especial effect: If playing cat cards. 


When you reach 5 likes Token or more, you can exchange immediately 5 likes Tokens to 1 Follower Token.

When one player reach 2 likes (3 in 4 players, 4 in 3 players, 5 in 2 players) this player win.

-description from designer

Name: Mint Rails
Description:
This is a mint tin game in the style of a light cube rails train game. Players collectively operate railway companies to increase company's worth and gain funds. Players can use funds to buy stock which is used at the end of the game to pay dividends out to determine the winner.

The theme is a Western theme with fictional train companies. The game is 1-4 players. The game can be played solo with a bot deck that is used to control the 2nd player.

On a player's turn, they can either 

     Buy stock
     Lay track


When laying track, the companies worth will increase and stock price decrease. So players need to find a balance when laying track.

—user summary

Name: Futory Cards
Description:
There is Chaos. With the invention of the Chronomachine, which enables the galaxy leaders to manipulate lifeforms and objects from different time zones, the common folk are fearful and confused. To restore the harmony which intends to only have one ruler in possession of the Chronomachine, the intergalactic federation calls for the 24 hour war.

Futory Cards is a deck building game in which up to four players buy cards from the Bazaar to create the strongest deck and defeat their opponents. With Landmarks, Creatures and Artifacts, the players go through four phases (Steam Phase, Construction Phase, Creature Phase and End Phase) in which they try to remove the 24 Time Points from the other players.

Once 12 Time Points are lost, the Light Die gets removed from the player and they can no longer get up to 24 Time Points. A player has lost the game after their Dark Die gets removed.

If a player can no longer draw cards from their Future Pile, their History Pile gets shuffled and creates a new Future Pile. This dynamic feature enables long term strategic thinking.

-description from designer

Name: Elements
Description:
Elements consists of cards with two properties: the element (earth, water, air, fire) and the shape (circle, triangle, square, pentagon). There are also Single Cards with only one property and the rare Element Cards that can transform into any card.

Each player starts with eight random cards. The first card from the drawing pile gets turned over and the players continue the series. The first player who has laid out all of their cards wins the game.

In their turn, a player can lay out as many cards as they want as long as the element or the shape from the top card is continued. Once made, the decision between element or shape cannot be changed while laying out cards (For example: A water circle is the top card. The player lays out a water circle and then a fire circle. With the fire circle they chose "shape" and are able to lay out earth or air circles but no other shapes).

If a player is unable to lay out any card, they draw three cards and the direction of the game changes. This enables the players to make strategic decisions on which cards to lay out and in what order.

-description from designer

Name: Fortress of Terror: Maze of the Minotaur
Description:
Due to your defeat of Bram at the Fortress of Terror and your destruction of the Temple of Despair, your name is becoming known to the neighboring lands. The fabled King Minos of a distant land has commissioned the construction of a labyrinth of unparalleled craftsmanship, and he claims to need your help in ridding the lands of a terrible, man-eating monster called the Minotaur. But there is something the king has failed to tell you...

In Maze of the Minotaur, you must navigate the ever-shifting labyrinth in search of the wandering Minotaur and defeat him in combat. The labyrinth is not only shifting, however - but also collapsing all around you. Additionally, the Minotaur has crafted the labyrinth to close in around you as you move, preventing you from retracing your steps! Once you have defeated the Minotaur, enter the tower at the center of the maze to free the labyrinth's architect Daedalus and his son Icarus and fly them to freedom!

Maze of the Minotaur is the third Fantasy Adventure Module in the Roll-With-It system, a modular, solitaire roll-and-write adventure game system with endless possibilities for adventure through an accomplish-the-task-and-escape-the-maze-style gameplay.

Gameplay is centered around a maze or map, through which the player must navigate, accomplish some objective(s), and escape the map under pressure from the enemy's attacks via the Doom die. The simple, puzzley, maze-style gameplay is approached differently in each adventure, building on the basic rules with new rules, concepts, and components that make each adventure feel fresh and unique.

-description from the publisher

Name: Wonky Wheels
Description:
Wonky Wheels  is a racing game (our interpretation of Mario Kart), where players race around the track collecting Power-Ups, with which to disrupt their opponents, modify their vehicle and gain advantages.

The track is a modular design, which allows players to create a range of circuits and incorporates octagon spaces which enable players to steer their vehicles.

Each player has an identical deck of Movement Cards and choose 1 of the 3 from their hand to move their vehicle each turn, drawing a 3rd card from their deck at the end of their turn. In addition, players manage the condition of the vehicles brakes, mechanics and tires using their Player Mat.

The game has many additional features and actions a player can take during their turn, such as driving over other vehicles, using free boosts and springs to advance. The Pits are an area they can repair damage to their vehicle and Super Power-Ups can be played 'out of turn'. The winner is the player who completes the designated number of laps the fastest.

Name: CDG Solo System Pack #2
Description:
The CDG Solo System is a revised GMT Edition of Stuka Joe's CDG solo method, which streamlines two-handed solitaire gameplay by decreasing turn to turn overhead and maintenance. This method of play increases narrative immersion as the great battles of history unfold on your tabletop.

CDG Solo System Pack #2 includes a red and yellow Card Display, a black fate die, the system rules and 6 new playsheets that add solo play to:
- 1960: The Making of The President
- Commands & Colors: Napoleonics
- Commands & Colors: Medieval
- WW2: Barbarossa to Berlin
- Pursuit of Glory
- Wilderness War

-description from publisher

Name: Perplexus Beast
Description: Do you have what it takes to make it through a 3D maze of 100 challenging obstacles? Put your skills to the test with Perplexus Beast! Flip, twist and spin Perplexus Beast 360 degrees to navigate the ball along the numbered track. Maneuver tricky obstacles like the laughing man, tight rope and super spiral without falling off the track! If your ball falls, head back to the start and try again. It’s an intense, bendy challenge you won’t be able to put down!
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: Cold Case: Murder with Interest
Description:
The Cold Case game line summons players to investigate the unsolved cases of victims murdered decades ago by piecing together the details that the police could never find. Inside the box, you will find realistic materials pertaining to the crime, and a complex story containing everything you need to crack the case. Follow the clues and submit your answers online to finally bring the killers to justice.

In Murder with Interest, players investigate a double murder that takes place at an office party in a small town in Ireland.

Name: Claim: Awakeners
Description:
Alternate faction that can be added to Claim or Claim 2.

After phase 1, shuffle the discarded cards and form a second deck. If you win a trick with an Awakener in phase 2, you draw a card from the second deck and place it in your Score Pile.

Name: Claim: Satyrs
Description:
Alternate faction that can be added to Claim or Claim 2.

In Phase 1, when the card where the players are competing off is a Satyr, the second player does not have to follow faction. The highest number is considered the winner of the trick.

Name: Claim: Tinkerers
Description:
Alternate faction for Claim or Claim 2.

In Phase 2, if a Tinkerer beats the other card by a value of 4 or more, then the Tinkerer explodes! The other card is discarded from the game. The player who played the Tinkerer still wins the trick and the other card.

Name: Claim: Valkyries
Description:
Alternate faction for Claim or Claim 2.

If the Valkyrie is played following another faction, it becomes that faction if it is valued 3 or higher than the first card played.

Name: Press Tour
Description:
The cameras are on and the microphones are hot! Grab a copy of your best-selling book or snag a press badge to take part in the media scrum. Hope you've memorized your talking points, because we are going live in 3... 2... 1!

In Press Tour, players take on the roles of attendees at the press-launch for a new book release, either as the author or one of the interviewers. Direct the interview to meet your personal goals or the requirements of your network to get the scoop of your career!

Name: Sute Sute Railroading
Description:
Sute Sute Railroading includes several methods of play (Simple, Regular, or Advanced), a few variants, and rules for a bonus game.  The rules include the designer's typical sense of humor, with tie breaking rules related to how many of the designer's games you own and a prohibition on asking them when a certain one of their designs will finally be released.

The "Simple" rule set seems to be identical to their 2010 release, Sute Sute Marketing.

The "Regular" rules involve playing cards to a network of cards on the table.  A player earns money equal to the increase in value of a train's network.  The player then draws 2 cards.  When the deck is exhausted, scores are calculated. The player with the most cards ("shares") of a company in their hand receives money equal to the company's value (stations); the player with the second most shares takes each share which belonged to to the player with the most shares.

After each company's accounts have been settled, players earn 1 yen for each card they have, and the player with the most money wins.

Name: Nephilim Fraternités
Description:
Nephilim Fraternités is the first board game in the Nephilim rpg universe. 
It is a game of cooperation between Nephilim to face their ancestral enemies, secret societies, while trying to acquire as much esoteric knowledge as they can. It takes place in past incarnation periods.
The game play is a mix of dice/worker placement where each player has a dice pool they use to start actions on the game board. Each action is linked to an element and can either allow better fighting against the secret societies or progression in the quest for knowledge.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Kingdoms Forlorn: Ten Thousand Succulent Fears Expansion
Description: A major Expansion for the Kingdoms Forlorn, this set expands on both Core Game Kingdoms and includes a 2 new sub-Kingdoms, Jura the Stronghold of the Saints, and Knight Campaign with over 50 hours of content.

Name: Kingdoms Forlorn: Red Kingdom of Eshin Expansion
Description: A major Kingdom expansion for the Kingdoms Forlorn, this set includes a new Kingdom (Red Kingdom of Eshin) and a new Knight Campaign with over 50 hours of content.

Name: Kingdoms Forlorn: Barony of Bountiful Harvest Expansion
Description: A major Kingdom expansion for the Kingdoms Forlorn, this set includes a new Kingdom (Sunken Kingdom of Utrebant) and a new Knight Campaign with over 50 hours of content.

Name: Escape from the Space Station
Description:
An out-of-this-world mini escape room game!

It’s not every day you find yourself trapped on a space station that’s hurtling towards an asteroid belt. And when the station is thrown off course, there’s no time for panicking! Your only shot at safety lies with a note written in a strange alphabet – it looks as if you’ll have to put your intergalactic thinking cap on! There are 12 different puzzles, from tricky picture puzzles to crazy mazes, and the solution for each one will translate a single letter of the note. Only once all 12 puzzles have been solved correctly and the note has been decoded, will you be able to make your escape from the space station!

Testing a variety of key skills from logic to numbers, there's a puzzle for everyone!

-description from publisher

Name: Last Chance Saloon: A Murder Mystery Game
Description:
It’s last orders in the only saloon in town, and there’s more to kill than just time!
 Will the richest rancher in the Wild West be dead before sundown, or will you be able to save his skin?
 The year is 1885 and death will cast its shadow over the quiet town of Ghost Creek unless your sleuthing skills are able to stop it! Inside the Last Chance Saloon, six people nurse their drinks, each lost in thought. A traveling fortune teller decides to stop and quench her thirst. Suddenly, she’s struck with a vision: Avery Rogers – Ghost Creek’s richest man – will be dead by the end of the day, and at the hands of someone in the saloon! Set in the Wild West, this murder mystery will immerse you and your dinner guests in a world of revenge, blackmail and bandits! Will you be able to unravel the clues and motives to pinpoint the would-be murderer, all before coffee is served?

-description from publisher

Name: Secrets of the Silver Screen: A Murder Mystery Game
Description:
Ruby Bloom is Hollywood’s leading lady. But away from the flashing lights of the paparazzi and her throng of adoring fans, she is a notorious bully, prone to explosive outbursts, vile tantrums and outrageous demands. Ruby is found poisoned in her dressing room on the set of her latest movie. From short-fused director Chuck Demeyer to long-suffering PA Jane Madison, there’s no shortage of people who want Ruby gone; but who finally killed her, and why?
 Set in the Golden Age of Hollywood, this immersive murder mystery will see you and your fellow dinner guests become both murder suspects and detectives. Will you be able to unravel the clues, pinpoint the motives and solve the murder before coffee is served?

-description from publisher

Name: Trash Talk
Description:
Leave your moral compass at the door and find out what your friends think of you with this outrageous game that’ll get you naming and shaming!

Players take turns to read out a card with a “Most likely to” or “Least likely to” scenario, then vote on which player they think best fits that description.

Discover who needs to rethink their life choices in this game of naming and shaming!

A game of no winners, but one loser. You don't want to be deemed the trashiest!

—description from publisher

Name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Flames & Frost: Kickstarter Edition
Description:
The Kickstarter editions comes packaged with Expansion Pack #03: Agents, Expansion Pack #04: Peasants & Knights, Duke Mico and 10 Alternate Art Starter Cards, which are not contained in the retail edition.

New threats have reared their monstrous heads in the land of Valeria! Scouts have reported seeing fiery hounds to the South and beasts that bring with them winter's deathly bite to the North. The King's heralds have been dispatched to all of the corners of Valeria to call upon new Adventurers for you to recruit while the workers lay the foundation of new Domains.

Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Flames and Frost adds two new powerful Monster stacks, a new set of Citizens to recruit, and new Domains for you to purchase.

Name: Stock Monarchy
Description:
Within Stock Monarchy you will play as the ruler of a small Kingdom listed on the stock market. The competition will be relentless. To win, players must bring their Kingdom to dominate the stock market with a savvy combination of warfare, technology and trade.

THE STOCK STATES
The Stock States are a rich empire with a bizarre form of government: a stock monarchy. The Supreme Sovereign wields absolute power, but his election and term in office are determined by the satisfaction of the stockholders, the true masters of the Land.

CORONATION CHALLENGE
The time has come to nominate a new Supreme Sovereign. As usual, the Coronation Challenge is issued so as to find the most talented contestant amongst the richest Houses of the Realm. The winner of the Challenge will be crowned Ruler of the Stock States.
The Challenge will take place on one of the peripheral and uncivilized islands of the empire. The Island is inhabited by Mattoks, somewhat obtuse and naïve creatures with a very basic lifestyle. Mattoks can’t quite discern between good and evil and are therefore easy to manipulate or to corrupt. They are not to be entrusted with complex tasks, but they are excellent at following simple instructions and will comply with whatever command in exchange for a few shiny coins.
At the beginning of the Challenge every participant will be assigned a starting region of equal dimension and three months’ time to showcase their strategic skills and – most important of all – to enrich the stockholders.
The management of the Realms on the Island mirrors the stock monarchy of the Stock States: each scion will be free to act as an authentic absolute monarch, but his choices will be evaluated by the stock market. Dominating the market, however, will not be easy: all shareholders ultimately desire to grow richer and see the value of their shares rise, but some of them also have specific preferences on how this should be done. The two most prominent examples are definitely the conqueror and pioneer currents. The conquerors want a Ruler in power who pursues profit through military expansion, while the pioneers prefer one who will enrich them by investing in technological growth. Therefore, whoever wants to sit on the Throne of the Stock States will not only have to effectively administer his own Realm, but will also have to distribute copious dividends and support, at least in part, the interests of conquerors and pioneers. Ultimately, the winner of the Coronation Challenge will be the Ruler who is able to impose himself on the market and make the value of the shares of his Realm soar.

GAME-FLOW
The Game-Flow has 3 stages: Setup, Round and End Game.

SETUP
• Creating the island: the Island is created, depending on the number of Players (in a 2-Player game it is possible to create more
than 2 billion different Map layouts, in a 4 Player game more than a trillion, and that's without counting Resources and Know-How Tokens).
• Auctioning the Starting Territories: Players bid to seize the best possible starting Territory for their Realms.
• Setting up the Realms: every Ruler autonomously chooses the initial Setup of their Realm.

ROUND
• 3 Game Rounds: The 3 Game Rounds is where the real action takes place. The Kings have to plan and implement their strategies by issuing orders to the Spies and Mattoks of their own Realm. This is done through the 14 Command Cards, which let Players move their Spies and carry out Actions with the Mattoks.

END GAME
• Distributing dividends to the shareholders: the Money, Ingots and revenue from the sale of White Whiskey are used to pay
dividends, which drives up the value of the shares of the Realm.
• Announcing the winner: the Player whose shares have reached the highest value is crowned as new Supreme Sovereign of the Stock States.

-description from designer

Name: Chicken Hunter
Description:
In Chicken Hunter, players simultaneously reveal cards from their hand, aiming to score points.   There are no restrictions on what cards players can reveal (e.g. does not need to be a straight, or x-of-a-kind).

In each round, two hands will be rewarded with points.  First, look at the players who revealed the fewest number of cards.  This player earns points equal to the number of cards they revealed multiplied by the sum of the face value of these cards.  (In the case of a tie, the tied players first discard one card each.)

Then, from the remaining players, look at the player with the lowest face value sum of the cards revealed.  This player scores points using the same calculation.

Afterwards, players draw up to 6 cards and repeat the process.

The game lasts until a player achieves a preset threshold and at that point the person with the most points wins.

Name: Der strenge Schupo
Description: The players take turns to roll and move. They have to get their 4 cars to the parking lot of their color to win the game. Before each turn the traffic police man in the middle of the board is rotated to block one direction of movement.

Name: West of Souls
Description:
West of Souls is innovative solo or cooperative fantasy adventure for 1-6 players. Enter the world of Eloria, plagued by darkness and monsters of a vitriolic nature. You and your party will explore and make decisions that directly affect the world’s infrastructure and future. The vastly branching storylines and numerous NPCs found in West of Souls ensure unique game play and future replay ability.

Enemy encounters and agonizing choices abound in this game and even the simplest of decisions may alter the world as you know it. Players will take up the mantle of an unlikely hero who, through motives of their own, have decided to stop Eloria’s impending doom. Be it gold, valor, or a deep empathy for the world around them, the players must work together to gain victory over scenarios and continue on their journey.

As players progress through the ever-changing world, they will develop their abilities, gain increasingly effective gear, and unlock additional skills specific to their character. Following each completed scenario, player choices will determine the future direction of the party’s quest, guaranteeing player involvement in the development of their own story. 
 The game is split into scenarios that are comprised of an exploration and journey phase, and each turn is split into a time of day (morning, mid-day, dusk, night). In the journey phase of the game, characters with travel throughout the game map discovering locations, triggering events, battling monsters, interacting with the world, and talking with NPCs to gain information about their quest and Eloria’s tainted past. Action point-based turns are used within West of Souls. Each player will have a defined number of actions that may be completed on their turn (unless you have unlocked a skill or found some gear that says otherwise). Once enough information has been gathered and players are in the correct location, the exploration phase begins.

One unique aspect of West of Souls is that the exploration phase is a hybrid of non-linear narrative, card-based battle encounters, and dungeon crawling. In addition, all characters in play do not have to enter the same exploration together, allowing for multiple explorations to occur simultaneously. Within the exploration phase, players will be forced to make harrowing choices, complete skill checks, and defeat beast to move forward. Vital story elements, lore, and history will be revealed to the players as they progress through the game.  
While death is an option in West of Souls, a player is never permanently removed from the game. The main resources in this epic journey are time and stress. If your team does not accomplish their goal within the allotted time frame, Eloria is cast into ruin. Likewise, if the encounters prove too much for your party and your stress level reaches a breaking point, you will lose the game. Victory is achieved at the end of each scenario as players defeat enemies of increasing difficultly and complete the necessary tasks. 
 This flagship game from Sky Monster Games is an ambitious story telling odyssey that maximizes the use of battle mechanics in combination with non-linear storytelling and character customization.

-description from designer

Name: Wer hat gut gelernt?
Description:
The answer cards are evenly dealt among the players, which take turns to roll and move one lone pawn about the game board. When the pawn stops on a space the player reads the question printed on the space. The player who thinks he has the right answer card gives the answer. If the answer is right the player gest a commendation, if not he gets a rebuke. The game ends when the pawn reaches or passes the last space. The player with the most commendations wins the game. But for each rebuke six commendations are substracted

—user summary.

Name: Roll & Write Railroads
Description:
In Roll & Write Railroads, the players are new employees of a railroad company, having just left their families' bean farms.  They were so good at running the bean farm, they were put in charge of all of the railroad projects. However, they have no knowledge of railroads!  So they made a die out of a soybean their parents entrusted them with, and leave their fate up to it.

On a turn, a player rolls one more dice than the number of players.  Then, in clockwise order, each player selects a die.  The players then take an action based upon the die number.  The actions involve laying track, building stations, and possibly gaining money.  Later, players may unlock ways to enhance these actions.

Players may only build from left to right, and only on train lines they have opened.

After each player finishes their actions, they each take a second action with the unselected die.  Then, the players score points based upon how far their stations have been built on each line.

After ten rounds, players sum their intermediate scores and also earn points for how many of their actions they enhanced.  The player with the most points wins.

Name: Power For The People
Description:
Power for the People is a political satire game that recreates the current divisive political environment. Players take on the role of an already powerful party leader. Each party leader is revered and respected by supporters and opponents alike, but are plagued with an insatiable desire for more power. Power is gained by gathering support from the party and by winning the influenceable party members of opponents’.

One party leader is the chairman for the round and takes on certain roles and responsibilities. He or she starts the round by saying, “for the people” at which point everyone picks up the hand they have been dealt and begins to play in an orderly fashion, always abiding by the rules and laws. Proper respect and decorum must be maintained during play including only speaking at appropriate times and only when required by rules and laws. Players keep each other in check by giving a penalty card from the top of the deck for observed deviation from the rules and laws. One player wins the round by playing his or her last card and proclaiming “Power for the People!”. The winning player collects power, creates a secret law, and becomes the chairman for the next round.

Play continues with the next round. All of the existing rules and laws are in force, but now a secret law is in play. Opponents of the new chairman must deduce the action or lack of action that the secret law requires. Doing so will avoid penalties and enable a potential future win allowing him or her to gain power and write a secret law of their own, for which he or she can penalize other players.

By the final round there may be up to 10 secret laws in effect. At this point it becomes challenging to remember all the laws and rules in order to avoid getting additional cards through penalties. At the end of the final round, the player with the most power becomes the Supreme Leader!

To review, in Power For The People, players establish the party platform, gain power, create and follow secret laws, penalize offenders, and become Supreme Leader!

Name: The God Game
Description:
The description on the box says "PLAY GOD!!! Start your own religion! Persecute non-believers! Send followers to heaven! Riotous spoof and FUN for 12 YEARS and older."

It plays like Sorry! with a few twists and turns.

It has a National Lampoon vibe. Adult themes. Irreverent. Edgy.

It was made by the American Publishing Corporation in Waltham, Massachusetts. This famous company no longer exists, but its infamous products live on. They made drug and sex themed board games, puzzles in cans (including Playboy centerfold puzzles), and politically incorrect books about how to fish, how to ski, and how to play golf. For example, one of their games is "LSD Ludicrous Systems Development: A Psychedelic Happening Construction Kit."

—user summary

Name: Marvel Lucha Libre Edition: La Lucha Infinita
Description:
Marvel Lucha Libre Edition characters fight one another, with a combination of luck and strategy to win 3 falls, and be the last "Rudo" or "Técnico" standing in the ring.

Roll dice to move your pawn, and if you land in a space with a wrestler from another player, you enter the ring... use one of your characters cards, then add the roll of your dice to see who comes out on top, win 3 falls and eliminate that wrestler. Last wrestler standing wins!

With 2 modes to play... Amateur and Pro Wrestler.

Name: Patty Stack
Description:
Whip out the spatulas and get to the grill! In Patty Stack, your goal is to construct the most delicious hamburger. You’ll score points for well-played cards, but be careful – you’ll lose points for any card you can’t play! Build your burger and then eat your hard work to find out how you stack up against the competition. It’s medium rare to find a game this well done.

Patty Stack is a dice-drafting and card placement game. On your turn, you will select a dice from the table and place a patty card on your patty stack that matches your die value. You can never stack two cards next to each other with matching values or matching toppings. You will score points for the cards you successfully stack, and will have a point deducted for cards you are unable to stack successfully. You spend the game stacking your patties, and then "eat your burger" to determine your final score.

-description from designer

Name: Brazil: Imperial – Autômato
Description:
Challenge an artificially simulated player!

Get ready for a new challenge in Brazil: Imperial. The Autômato is an implacable adversary that will put all his experience as the leader of his nation to the test.

It is possible to use the Autômato in solo matches or add it to maps with more players, which helps to create a new gameplay, with an unpredictable opponent that does not accept negotiation!

Brazil: Imperial - Automato is a new module for Brazil: Imperial containing 21 new cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape the Minotaur's Maze
Description:
A competitive fast-paced dungeon crawling game for two to four players.  Game plays in 30-45 minutes.

Each game begins with a maze generated from randomly drawn dungeon cards.  The players take turns exploring and moving through the maze.  They can play cards from their hand to replace explored tiles to make it easier for them to escape or hinder the competing players.

The first to recover the magical Chalice and escape is the winner.

Play one of four different characters with unique attack and defense abilities to help you survive the minotaur’s fury.

-description from publisher

Name: Daiquiri
Description:
Daiquiri is a middle-weight domino climbing game for 3 or 4 players.

You will need 3 or 4 sets of double-six dominoes depending on the number of players.

There are no teams; it’s every person for themselves. Your score will depend solely on the position you go out so go out early.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Fiddich
Description:
Fiddich is a heavy-weight climbing game that uses 4 sets of double six dominoes and is played by strictly 4 players in fixed partnerships, 2 vs 2.

Each player is given a set of 7 blank tiles (their Glen). These tiles can be used to form ordinary combinations and they can be used to form bombs. They offer flexibility and power. Everyone has them. Use yours wisely.

Your goal is to shed 28 tiles (including your Glen).

The game is all about going out early as a team. The only team that will score is the team that goes out first, but their score will depend on when the rest of the team goes out. If your team does NOT go out first, your job is simple: make the other team go out as late as possible.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Soll + Haben mit Schlau & Lau
Description:
Both players get the same starting capital and agree on a fixed playing time. Each player gets one meeple and both start at the same starting space. Movement is like a rock in chess, any number of spaces in any orthogonal direction. Each space allows for a business transaction and the players use double entry bookkeeping to manage the ballace of their business portfolio.
At the end of the game the player with the highest profit wins the game.

The game was most likely published in the early 60s.

Name: Hawker Wars
Description:
A mouth-watering party game that lets you compete to cook some of the most iconic hawker dishes in Singapore.

Each player owns a hawker stall. On every player's turn, the player draws two ingredient cards and one action card. Then they take up to two of the following actions: (a) COOK: Cook a dish by matching the ingredients on hand with ingredients on the Dish card. Each dish is worth a certain number of points, (b) ACTION: Play an action card, or (c) TRADE: Trade 2 ingredients on hand with 1 ingredient from the Black Market

The first player that reaches the target number of points wins.

-description from publisher's website

Name: What Lies Beneath
Description:
You dream you're in a chapel. Small, high-pitched voices sing an ancient song. Yet a sense of unease washes through you. The core is more macabre. Dream yields to waking confusion. Dust, bones and dried death. A flickering torch. Underground. A crypt.

You catch a wisp of a breeze, heavy with the stench of rot. You gag. Yet a breeze suggests a way out. You take the torch, determined to get out of here alive.

Synopsis
Structured as a branching narrative, What Lies Beneath invites you to direct the plot – but only if you master a unique combination of game mechanisms. Enjoy all the challenges of solo roleplay:


     Buffing your character: Gain items that unlock new powers
     Classic skill checks: Roll against thresholds to hit enemies
     Intellectual puzzles: Manipulate dice using limited actions
     Dexterity tests (optional): Flick dice at specified targets


And when (not if) you die, you can spend experience points to boost your next character. Perhaps, this time, you will survive.

Name: Escape the Lich King
Description:
Escape the Lich King is a cooperative 20 card game of Dungeon escape through discovery and attack. A party of three stalwart adventures have overestimated their worth while exploring the nearest dungeon and find themselves desperate to escape alive.

Pursued by hordes of monsters and the Big Boss, the party must find their lost weapons while fending off the horde.  To escape the dungeon, they must each find one of three potions that will help teleport them out of the dungeon.  If enough monsters set on the trail of the party, they notify the Big Boss who moves in for the final attack to stop them from escaping.

If the party can fend off the monsters while fleeing the dungeon and all drink the three potions together, they can escape the dungeon with their lives.
   
Player Win conditions:
The three players win if they each have a character card, a matching weapon card and a potion card showing.  Then all three players will drink from their potions during the Cleanup Phase to teleport out of the dungeon and win the game.

Big Boss win conditions:
If the total value of all revealed monsters is greater than 10 at the end of the Battle Phase, the players lose and the Big Boss player wins.

-description from designer

Name: Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City –  Families and Outcasts
Description:
The Families and Outcasts expansion adds the 7th district, the Badlands, to the board — a new region for exploration during the game. It also brings 1 brand-new story and 2 more gangs to the game, the Aldecaldos and the Wraiths, also increasing the game's maximum player count to 5!

The Badlands district board is a 4-fold game board that is attached to the bottom right corner of Night City, mirroring the geography of the Cyberpunk 2077 in-game location.

—description from the publisher

Name: Narcopolis
Description:
Narcopolis is an immersive and competitive board game. The game is played in the South of United States during the year 2000. It's a tactical game with bluffing. You have to be diplomatic and play dirty. Players light on the interactions and have fun around the table. The goal of Narcopolis is to become the new boss of the town. To become the new Boss, you have to be the one with the highest rate of reputation at the end of the Game. The Game finishes either when someone arrive to 20 points of reputation or after 10 turns.

You will play one of 5 characters and will evolve within a city where you will have to attack, conquer and develop resources to gain reputation points. Bluffing, corruption and strategy are key elements of the game.You will have to build casinos, weapons and other resources specific to the gang world to take control of the city.

Each turn every player have to play 2 obligatory actions (take money and move) and can do 5 more actions (play or buy influence card, do or exchange job, develope new Business, conquer a new area by fighting or just Build up new Business, Buy or sale reputation point).  To take territories to an enemy you have to play a dice fight which include a bluffing part. Every round turn the first player will revel a new event card which changes the game that round.

-description from writer

Name: Casting Shadows: Exclusive Edition
Description:
The Kickstarter Exclusive Edition comes with:

- Casting Shadows Base Game in Kickstarter Exclusive Edition Box with alternate art, a magnetic box upgrade, and a removable sleeve with the standard edition art. The box is upgraded to accomodate sleeved cards as well as cards and components in the Ice Storm Expansion Pack.

- 2 Kickstarter Exclusive Player Boards (Iris Papillon / Iris The Obscure; Tusk Swiftwave / Tusk The Tidemaster)

- 3 Kickstarter Exclusive Hex Tiles (Glimmering Woods; Coral Ridge; Crystal Crypt)

- 15 Kickstarter Exclusive standard-sized cards:

     4 Kickstarter Exclusive Companions (Vital Shroom; Dark Flutter; Lil' Shadow; Hammerhead Harvester)
     3 Kickstarter Exclusive Resource cards (Purple Orb; 2 Shadow Fragment; Purple Gem)
     3 Kickstarter Exclusive Attack Spells (Coral Katana; Venomous Strike; Warp Drop)
     2 Kickstarter Exclusive Conversion Spells (Gem Alchemy; Orb Alchemy)
     3 Kickstarter Exclusive Counterspells (Worst Curse; Unexpected Attack; Fly Away!)

Name: Meeple Detective
Description:
Meeple Detective is a deduction game that players must compete with other players to trace and apprehend Phantom and his minions.

The game have 2 PHASES :

ACTION PHASE
1. Each player must flip 1 card face up permanently and peek adjacent 1 card.

2.Check what type of card the player has last faced up.
2.1 If a face up card is a hostage room card or the clue room card : Nothing happened then next player will continue to play.
2.2 If a face up card is an event room card, active player must draw 1 time card and check what type of card opened is: 
> investigate : Enter the investigative phase.
> empty room : Nothing happened then next player will continue to play.

INVESTIGATION PHASE
1. Starting from active player. Each player may place their Meeple (s) on any room card or pass.
2. If you are a first player of that card, place 1 Meeple, if not, place 2 Meeples.
3. When it comes back to active player, INVESTIGATION PHASE end.

Game end immediately after complete investigation phase 4 times. Then, scoring begins. Player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Golem: Promo Cards
Description:
This small promo expansion adds 3 new Characters cards to play with the base game.

B1: Carry out the action of 1 available Rabbi tile.

B2: Move your Golems a total of 2 steps & move your marker up
the Study track I step & activate 1 Golem (lay it down).
